attributes.action: Remove Shortage Occupation Jobs from Annual Tier-2 Visa Immigration Quotas/Limit
attributes.additional_details:
Since December 2017, businesses (and inevitably taxpayers) have had to fund the 261.9% increase in annual salary required for front-line overseas NHS medical practitioners. This equates to an additional £24-35k increase in salary per candidate to qualify for entry.

Reverse the immigration policy prohibiting skilled, overseas Doctors/Dentists. Jobs falling under ‘shortage occupation’ must be considered out with annual allocations of Restricted (Tier-2 Non-EU/Overseas) Certificate of Sponsorship
attributes.background:
By hindering prospective NHS medical practitioners, the public’s well-being and health is being sacrificed by the UK Government.

The Government’s attempt showcase lower immigration numbers comes at the sacrifice to businesses, economy, and patient care. The NHS is underfunded and stricken.
